verses.kjv: Paul, an apostle, (not of men, neither by man, but by Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead;)
verses.web: Paul, an apostle—not from men, nor through man, but through Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead—
verses.ct: This letter is from Paul, an apostle — not appointed by any human authority or human institution, but by Jesus Christ and God the Father, who raised him from the dead.

verses.kjv: And all the brethren which are with me, unto the churches of Galatia:
verses.web: and all the brothers who are with me, to the assemblies of Galatia:
verses.ct: All the brothers and sisters here with me join me in writing to the churches throughout Galatia.

verses.kjv: Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.web: Grace to you and peace from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.ct: May grace and peace be yours from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ,

verses.kjv: Who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us from this present evil world, according to the will of God and our Father:
verses.web: who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us out of this present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father—
verses.ct: who gave himself for our sins to rescue us from this present evil age, just as God our Father planned.

verses.kjv: To whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
verses.web: to whom be the glory forever and ever. Amen.
verses.ct: To God be glory forever and ever. Amen.

verses.kjv: I marvel that ye are so soon removed from him that called you into the grace of Christ unto another gospel:
verses.web: I marvel that you are so quickly deserting him who called you in the grace of Christ to a different “good news”,
verses.ct: I'm shocked that you're already turning away from the one who called you by the grace of Christ, and chasing after a different gospel.

verses.kjv: Which is not another; but there be some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.
verses.web: but there isn’t another “good news.” Only there are some who trouble you and want to pervert the Good News of Christ.
verses.ct: There is no other gospel — it's just that certain people are stirring up confusion among you and trying to twist the gospel of Christ into something it's not.

verses.kjv: But though we, or an angel from heaven, preach any other gospel unto you than that which we have preached unto you, let him be accursed.
verses.web: But even though we, or an angel from heaven, should preach to you any “good news” other than that which we preached to you, let him be cursed.
verses.ct: But even if we ourselves — or an angel from heaven — were to preach a gospel different from the one we already gave you, let that person be cursed.

verses.kjv: As we said before, so say I now again, If any man preach any other gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.
verses.web: As we have said before, so I now say again: if any man preaches to you any “good news” other than that which you received, let him be cursed.
verses.ct: I've said it before, and I'll say it again: if anyone preaches a gospel to you that contradicts what you already received, let that person be cursed.

verses.kjv: For do I now persuade men, or God? or do I seek to please men? for if I yet pleased men, I should not be the servant of Christ.
verses.web: For am I now seeking the favor of men, or of God? Or am I striving to please men? For if I were still pleasing men, I wouldn’t be a servant of Christ.
verses.ct: Am I trying to win the approval of people, or of God? Am I trying to please people? If I were still trying to please people, I wouldn't be a servant of Christ.

verses.kjv: But I certify you, brethren, that the gospel which was preached of me is not after man.
verses.web: But I make known to you, brothers, concerning the Good News which was preached by me, that it is not according to man.
verses.ct: I want you to know, brothers and sisters, that the gospel I preached to you didn't come from any human source.

verses.kjv: For I neither received it of man, neither was I taught it, but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.web: For I didn’t receive it from man, nor was I taught it, but it came to me through revelation of Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: I didn't receive it from any person, and no one taught it to me. It came to me through a direct revelation from Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: For ye have heard of my conversation in time past in the Jews’ religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God, and wasted it:
verses.web: For you have heard of my way of living in time past in the Jews’ religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the assembly of God and ravaged it.
verses.ct: You've heard about my former life in Judaism — how I violently persecuted God's church and did everything I could to destroy it.

verses.kjv: And profited in the Jews’ religion above many my equals in mine own nation, being more exceedingly zealous of the traditions of my fathers.
verses.web: I advanced in the Jews’ religion beyond many of my own age among my countrymen, being more exceedingly zealous for the traditions of my fathers.
verses.ct: I was advancing in Judaism faster than many of my peers, driven by an extreme devotion to the traditions of my ancestors.

verses.kjv: But when it pleased God, who separated me from my mother’s womb, and called me by his grace,
verses.web: But when it was the good pleasure of God, who separated me from my mother’s womb and called me through his grace
verses.ct: But God, who set me apart before I was even born and called me by his grace,

verses.kjv: To reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the heathen; immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood:
verses.web: to reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the Gentiles, I didn’t immediately confer with flesh and blood,
verses.ct: chose to reveal his Son to me so that I could preach him among the Gentiles. When that happened, I didn't consult with anyone.

verses.kjv: Neither went I up to Jerusalem to them which were apostles before me; but I went into Arabia, and returned again unto Damascus.
verses.web: nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me, but I went away into Arabia. Then I returned to Damascus.
verses.ct: I didn't go up to Jerusalem to meet with the apostles who came before me. Instead, I went to Arabia, and later returned to Damascus.

verses.kjv: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and abode with him fifteen days.
verses.web: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to visit Peter, and stayed with him fifteen days.
verses.ct: Then, 3 years later, I went up to Jerusalem to visit Peter and stayed with him for 15 days.

verses.kjv: But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord’s brother.
verses.web: But of the other apostles I saw no one except James, the Lord’s brother.
verses.ct: I didn't see any of the other apostles — only James, the Lord's brother.

verses.kjv: Now the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.
verses.web: Now about the things which I write to you, behold, before God, I’m not lying.
verses.ct: I swear before God that everything I'm writing to you is the truth.

verses.kjv: Afterwards I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia;
verses.web: Then I came to the regions of Syria and Cilicia.
verses.ct: After that, I traveled to the regions of Syria and Cilicia.

verses.kjv: And was unknown by face unto the churches of Judaea which were in Christ:
verses.web: I was still unknown by face to the assemblies of Judea which were in Christ,
verses.ct: The churches in Judea that belonged to Christ had never met me in person.

verses.kjv: But they had heard only, That he which persecuted us in times past now preacheth the faith which once he destroyed.
verses.web: but they only heard: “He who once persecuted us now preaches the faith that he once tried to destroy.”
verses.ct: All they knew was what others told them: "The man who used to persecute us is now preaching the very faith he once tried to destroy."

verses.kjv: And they glorified God in me.
verses.web: So they glorified God in me.
verses.ct: And they praised God because of what he had done in me.
